page.title: 03St. Luke's Church, Onecote
page.content: St. Luke's Church was built in the 18th century. It is made of limestone and has got stained glass windows throughout. The church is surrounded almost completely by the grave yard which contains 172 graves, 142 of which have headstones, some dating back to the 18th century. The services at the church are held every Sunday at 10 o'clock and the church bell rings before the service. The church will seat about 204 people but only 22 members regularly attend. The congregation is made up mostly of local people. St. Luke's does not have a choir. There are two church wardens who help the vicar. A parish magasine comes out every month. In 1984 there was one marriage, three baptisms and one funeral.
